comments.commentBody: Do you think that to vote for GOP candidate or stay home will realize your ideal?  It will be a nightmare.

Kill the bills!  Copyright infringement occurs, but that doesn't give the aggrieved parties to shut off access to places on the Internet.  If thieves use certain roads to commit their crimes, do banks get to shut down the roads?  I don't think so.  You go after the criminal, not the road.

I haven't made my way through the nearly 1000 comments, but has anyone addressed whether sopa/pipa are constitutional? Enjoining speech that is not even tortious, let alone criminal, as a consequence/punishment for committing speech acts that are tortious or criminal surely runs afoul of long-standing first amendment doctrines of overbreadth and prior restraint.

These laws sound like they are akin to shutting down the New York Times, in its entirely, because the paper ran one defamatory article. Absurd.

Rev. Preston Moore

How could you write such a long piece without mentioning the technical and infrastructural damage this bill would cause ? The impact on innovation and culture?

This isn't just about the First Amendment. It's about a nightmare where the Feds can pull your website and throw the book at you because of something someone else posted on your site.

You're a shill, bro, and it is showing.

If it were all a big nothing burger as some of our congresspersons suggest, it is hard to believe the internet giants would take this step. I think politicians underestimate our intelligence. SOPA and PIPA would ruin a lot of blogging sites. The owners of the sites may comply with the law but can't patrol each comment thread for unscrupulous violators who copy and paste entire articles from the Associate Press. Well, we could do that but it would get old very quickly and you could never be sure you'd caught them all, especially the people who don't like what you're saying and want to make sure your blog disappears from the blogosphere.
I don't want to have to self-censor everything I type for fear of infringing on copyright. That could happen unintentionally. It's sounds like just another way to herd us. We have to take our shoes off in the airport, make sure we don't ever let our kids out of our sight, never say anything controversial at work and now make sure we don't get the unwanted attention of Disney.
Enough already

@Christopher, 12:05 am: if you're old enough to remember Carter, you surely GW Bush and the absolute hash he made of this country. The economic crisis that Obama inherited was caused by a financial bubble and recoveries from such downturns take years, no matter who's in charge or what they do.

Health care had to be reformed. Had to. The system was absolutely broken and it was slowly choking our economy and way of life.

Finally, if you think that Romney or Gingrich can do a better job than Obama, you are seriously deluded.

President Obama is no different than Jimmy Carter's one term and consequentially should be not given a second term.  He wasted an inordinate amount of time on the healthcare fiasco and will probably will be overturned by the Supreme Court.  Why can't people who voted admit he is a failure and move on?  We all can't be successful at a job and so we should find a new applicant and hope they will be able to do a better and more focused job.  A great disappointment and that is a truthful assessment.

The public has to go to extreme lengths because the public does not have gazillions of dollars to spend on lobbying and superpacs.  Allegedly congress represents us, but we dont own them so it can take ridiculously extreme massive mobilization to get their attention at all.
The analysis sounds vile. Piers Morgan... really?   I might wait for the game to finish and then download it with proper commentary.
But the important question is, will the Fox football robot pop up in a goalie kit?

To tom below:

A fire is engulfing a stadium, and the announcement is made: "There is evidence that rushing to exit 12 may provide escape from the fire!"

I would say there would be quite a mob who went in that direction. When talking about a cure for dreaded disease, measured terminology is not translated as such.
Bad diets can cause cancer. My mother was round, ate a healthy diet, walked every day, did mega-zillions of crosswords, but she died of cancer in her 70's. I still believe in statistics.

One preaches and preaches to NYT about English language nonsense, poor syntax. A lot more discipline and stringency would help. Some mess now. Read the captions for photographs for a short course. NYT ignores preaching and has fires editors.
Salt may cause Alzheimer's.
Piers is a big Arsenal supporter, too!

Many thanks to Wikipedia, Reddit, Wired and the others who are making it possible to send this message to Congress.

I sent my first donation to Wikipedia today and it won't be the last.

When I retired, one of the criteria for where to live was public transportation. I found it in Portland, Oregon. Last year I decided to give up driving completely. It's been a revelation! It took me a few months of riding busses, but I finally got the courage to bike around town. I've done it all winter too, and now don't ever want to go back to driving. I'm so much less isolated, get much more exercise and generally feel my quality of living has improved greatly. OK, it's not quite Paris, but it's pretty great.
We all know the drill...eat nutritiously, with limited calories and exercise daily.  In my mid-70's, that's what I do.  It is our best chance of retaining our health.
Somehow I don't trust our Supreme Court to consider the needs of flesh and blood people superior corporate persons.
So...You are muscular then, and therefore not obese? That doesn't make what they are saying invalid.

Republican de-regulation and refusal to enforce laws cause this financial mess, use their stupidly-given majority in the House to fight every solution the President and the Democrats propose to solve the nation's financial problems, tell the American people that more of what they did is the solution, not the problem, and independent voters cannot see that they are as dishonest and dishonorable as the day is long ?   I don't think so.  The President will detail these problems and fess up that his mistake was trying to work with Republican obstructionists because the public still thought republicans were trying in good faith to solve poblems.  When the President tells people that the only way the nation will solve its problems is to retire the dishonest republicans, people will pay attention because they are not used to hearing the President draw a line in the sand, and they want him to.  They think the President is weak for not taking on the republicans in a battle to the end and relying on the good judgment of the American people to back him.  If the President won't put himself on the line for the nation, the nation will not put itself on the line for him.  It's that simple.
You must be stupid to think Google and Yahoo etc don't have a gigantic lobby in washington.

While I agree that it is not a fair measure for people that are very muscular, the majority of people are not, and it works for them.  Also, at 6' and 195 you have a BMI of 26.4, which is "overweight" on the chart, and actually on the low end of "overweight." To qualify as obese at 6 foot you would have to weigh over 220 pounds.

That doesn't come out to obese at all. That comes out to a BMI of 26 - barely in the "overweight" category - where it's well understood higher muscle mass can push you. That's not what's being talked about here.

That said, however, it's worth noting that however unfair it may feel, the increased risks of higher blood pressure and such mostly apply whether your BMI is high because of muscle or fat.
Pelosi and Boxer are the souls of high ethics and family values!  Once bought, they STAY bought.

Thanks TPP for your reply!

-Holmes
